title: Keen 1 Level Competition WINNERS!!
content:
It was an awesome level pack, big thanks to everyone who made a level! And here are the winners! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

The Most Keenish
[img]http://keengrid.net/keenrush/keenish.png[/img]
ceilick, Zorath, and Grandy (each of them with 2 points)

The Most Garging
[img]http://keengrid.net/keenrush/garging.png[/img]
Djaser (with 4 points, followed by freeyorp101, z-one, and ceilick, each with 2 points)

The Most Yorping
[img]http://keengrid.net/keenrush/yorping.png[/img]
Shadow Master (with 5 points)

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-birthday.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img] Congratulations to all winners!!

Here you can see who made which level:

16 Shadow Master3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Winners!
content:
*Thunderous Applause*

Very well organized, presented, and managed contest, KR. Kudos to you for putting something like this together--I'd be interested in future contests along these lines.

Congrats to Ceilick--Your style as a Keener has really come along as time has gone by, and I think you're one of the most productive modders we have. I should have recognized your ability to construct believable structures out of simple square blocks!

Congrats to Zorath--Similarly, you pieced together a set of architecture that really reminded me of Keen1, even if the difficulty was a little higher than the original. Your level was clearly divided into sections, which really helped the flow, in a player's mind.

Congrats to Grandy--Your level was epic-sized, but it was stitched together from recognizable patterns and pieces of Keen levels that were familiar enough to lead us in the right direction, in most cases. I personally didn't make it too far in your level, but the spirit remains true.

Congrats to Djaser--Most Garging, indeed. Your level was difficult to complete, even with God Mode! Is it even possible to make the jump for the Blue Keycard? You're cruel. Very cruel.

Congrats to Shadow Master--Welcome to the club! Your level had consistent design, start to finish, and had a few splashes of color in the architecture. Pillars of stand-on-able blocks that didn't serve a functional purpose, yet helped the level not feel barren. I like your style.

Congrats to everyone who enetered--This was a fantastic community demonstration, and I am thrilled to be a part of it. You guys are truly Keen.

Edit: The only comments MY level received were "Cute old-school Ice Level" and "Not much of a challenge."

title: Re: Keen 1 Level Competition WINNERS!!
content:
Oh yeah, I finally wan an award in the Keen community and complete in style it's dubious if this one is something to be proud of.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Is it even possible to make the jump for the Blue Keycard?[hr][/quote]
Yes, it is but a more important question is if the blue keycard is of any use at all?

[quote]Quote:[hr]You're cruel. Very cruel.[hr][/quote]
Hey were did you think the 'c' stands for in Holy C. Djaser?

This was my first level, my level design was partly inspired by the Smile mod, so thank you Keenrush. I did the level in maybe two hours or so just to put a few ideas together, some of them worked out great and some of them made the level very difficult/annoying/garging to play. One thing is certain: IF I ever make a mod again it will be easier to play.

Congrats to everyone who contributed to the contest no matter if it was with votes or levels. Especially a big thumbs up to the other winners. (Although it's weird that the Keen award winners got my garg nominations)

last not least: a big booh and much rotten tomatoes to everyone who didn`t vote but could have. You know who you are!-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen 1 Level Competition WINNERS!!
content: Wow great! That was a really awesome mod, we'll have to do it again, maybe with an added twist.

title: Re: Keen 1 Level Competition WINNERS!!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]The Most Yorping: Shadow Master (with 5 points)[hr][/quote]
Aha! I would have made it more difficult. For example, in the part of the floor made of green algae, originally the roof was also made of it, and there were 2 additional yorps, making it difficult, plus fire at the entrance, for the player to make it alive with the green key without time and patience.

Anyway, talking of level design, my mods, overall, will be composed by really difficult levels... er. Well, not so difficult, just a combination of peaceful levels and dangerous levels with shooting rooms and obstacle-dodging rooms.

Huh, I could beat Djaser's level after dying 3 times anyway. Strange, I'm not so nimble.

Well, congratulations to you all, and I hope we'll have a Keen 2 level competition too some day. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"
